author: Pratyush Patra
title: Delhi remains an unsolved mystery for Arif Zakaria
text:
For actor Arif Zakaria, who was in the capital as part of a stage play rece , Delhi is a mystery.
READ: Love stories that didn't have a 'happily ever after' ending
" Work has brought me to Delhi many a time, but I am yet to grasp the true essence of the city . I would like to stay here for a longer stretch of time to unravel the mystery that Delhi is for me,"he says.However, it doesn't stop him from enjoying the good things that the city has to offer. "You get to taste authentic north Indian food here. Also, you get mouthwatering sweets at Bengali Market. The variety of cuisines available in Delhi is remarkable," he says. He even has a question about the city . "Someone told me that Delhi is polluted and you don't get to see the sun shining in its full glory. Is that true?" he asks. On his association with theatre, Arif said, "I have done lead roles in off-beat films and supporting roles in mainstream ones. When it comes to theatre, I have done it in phases. I have chosen to do it only when I found the character being offered very exciting." About the Delhi audience, he said, "It was wonderful performing here. I am happy that they patiently watched our play and later, many of them came to congratulate us for a successful show."
